alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 12 at 5:35PM MST until December 12 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 533 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Village At Oak Creek, just south of Sedona, moving northeast at 20 mph, and headed towards I-17. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 302 and 326. State Route 179 between mile markers 302 and 312. Locations impacted include... Stoneman Lake, Munds Park and Village At Oak Creek. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
